Original Requirements: Create a ticket management web application that allows users to report issues at a university campus
Product Goals: Provide an efficient and user-friendly ticket management system
Enable helpdesk staff to effectively manage and resolve tickets
Improve communication between users and helpdesk staff through the application
User Stories: As a user, I want to be able to report issues and view the status of my tickets
As a helpdesk staff, I want to be able to view all tickets, assign status, and exchange messages with users
As a user, I want to receive notifications when my ticket is updated or resolved
As a helpdesk staff, I want to be able to analyze ticket data and visualize trends
As a user, I want to have a simple and intuitive interface to interact with the application
Competitive Analysis: Freshdesk: A popular ticket management system with robust features
Zendesk: A comprehensive customer service platform with advanced analytics
JIRA Service Management: A powerful IT service management tool with customizable workflows
ServiceNow: A cloud-based platform for IT service management and automation
OSTicket: An open-source ticket management system with a simple and intuitive interface
Competitive Quadrant Chart:
quadrantChart
    title "Ticket Management Systems"
    x-axis "Low Customizability" --> "High Customizability"
    y-axis "Low Scalability" --> "High Scalability"
    quadrant-1 "Basic Solutions"
    quadrant-2 "Growing Businesses"
    quadrant-3 "Enterprise Solutions"
    quadrant-4 "Specialized Tools"
    "Freshdesk": [0.6, 0.8]
    "Zendesk": [0.8, 0.9]
    "JIRA Service Management": [0.9, 0.95]
    "ServiceNow": [0.95, 0.98]
    "OSTicket": [0.4, 0.6]
    "Our Target Product": [0.7, 0.85]
Requirement Analysis: The application requires a robust and scalable architecture to handle a large volume of tickets and user interactions. The system should provide an intuitive interface for users to report issues and track the status of their tickets. Helpdesk staff should have access to advanced features such as ticket assignment, status updates, and data analytics. The application should also provide notifications and messaging capabilities to facilitate communication between users and helpdesk staff.
Requirement Pool: Implement a user-friendly interface for reporting issues and tracking ticket status
Develop a robust and scalable architecture to handle a large volume of tickets and user interactions
Implement advanced features for helpdesk staff such as ticket assignment and status updates
Develop data analytics and visualization capabilities for helpdesk staff
Implement notifications and messaging capabilities to facilitate communication between users and helpdesk staff
UI Design draft: The application will have a simple and intuitive interface with the following elements: a ticket submission form, a ticket dashboard for users to track their tickets, and an admin panel for helpdesk staff to manage tickets and access analytics. The interface will be responsive and accessible on various devices.
Anything UNCLEAR: The requirements do not specify the exact technology stack or infrastructure for the application. Additionally, the requirements do not provide details on user authentication and authorization, which will need to be clarified in further discussions.
